normalized: fluorescent lights, which had had their amount of light limited as much as possible, lined the way at regular intervals.
underneath that cold lighting, yukikaze, shizuru-san and i were proceeding down the corridor, which stretched out in an arc.
there were no signs of living things in our surroundings apart from ourselves.

leds, which had been installed on the various pipes along the outer circumference of the corridor, blinked at times, and along that outer edge, a faint hum was only just audible from the cyborg manufacturing plant below.
i had felt it before as well, but there was an eeriness, as if i had set foot inside an enormous machine.
this was a world that did not tolerate the existence of any living thing.
the washizu material co.
research facility.
2 hours had already passed since we began the infiltration.
being the most proficient at covert activities in here, since i was a wind escape user, i was the one leading the way.
yukikaze followed after me, and, as one would expect, shizuru-san, who excelled at infiltrating, was solidifying our rear guard.

due to shizuru-san's investigation, we already had a pretty good guess as to the location.

that had been abrupt as far as the other two were concerned, but they weren't going to start asking questions all of a sudden because of it.
